page.title: 05HONLEY'S SPIDER ALLEY
page.content: A centuries old walk in the village of Honley would be lost if a builder's {planning application}went ahead. {"Spider Alley",}which is sometimes named "Honley Gardens", has been here for many centuries and numerous people in Honley want to see it stay. Over a thousand people have signed a{petition to save the Alley, a path leading to the former "Stepping Stones" across the River Holme. The protesters argued that there was sufficient building land in Honley to meet housing demands. The plan would be bad for the village's character, amenity and setting. A walk with trees, fields, river and waterfall, is something a community should always have. Long live "Spider Alley"!
